channel.title: CVE Feed for villatheme -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for villatheme -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-30482|2024-09-25T16:50:41.657Z -- villatheme -- wpbulky
item.description: Auth. (contributor+) Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in VillaTheme WPBulky plugin <=Â 1.0.10 versions.

item.title: CVE-2024-8277|2024-09-11T18:07:22.496Z -- villatheme -- woocommerce%20photo%20reviews%20premium
item.description: The WooCommerce Photo Reviews Premium plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to authentication bypass in all versions up to, and including, 1.3.13.2. This is due to the plugin not properly validating what user transient is being used in the login() function and not properly verifying the user's identity. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to log in as user that has dismissed an admin notice in the past 30 days, which is often an administrator. Alternatively, a user can log in as any user with any transient that has a valid user_id as the value, though it would be more difficult to exploit this successfully.

item.title: CVE-2024-4039|2024-08-01T20:26:57.279Z -- villatheme -- orders%20tracking%20for%20woocommerce
item.description: The The Orders Tracking for WooCommerce plugin for WordPress for WordPress is vulnerable to arbitrary shortcode execution in all versions up to, and including, 1.2.10. This is due to the plugin allowing users to execute an action that does not properly validate a value before running do_shortcode. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary shortcodes. A partial patch was released in 1.2.10, and a complete patch was released in 1.2.11.

item.title: CVE-2024-4039|2024-06-04T17:53:54.286Z -- villatheme -- orders%20tracking%20for%20woocommerce

item.title: CVE-2024-8277|2024-09-11T08:31:05.071Z -- villatheme -- woocommerce%20photo%20reviews%20premium
item.description: The WooCommerce Photo Reviews Premium plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to authentication bypass in all versions up to, and including, 1.3.13.2. This is due to the plugin not properly validating what user transient is being used in the login() function and not properly verifying the user's identity. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to log in as user that has dismissed an admin notice in the past 30 days, which is often an administrator. Alternatively, a user can log in as any user with any transient that has a valid user_id as the value, though it would be more difficult to exploit this successfully.
